result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Morgan E Geyser was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Morgan E Geyser in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton and attorney Donna Kuchler. Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz and attorney Kevin Osborne appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Court calls the matter at 9:06 am for a sentencing and disposition hearing.
Attorney Cotton request to have Ms. Geyser handcuffs removed for the hearing. Court leaves it up to the Sheriff department.
Court makes opening statements regarding the background of the case. 
Atty. Szczupakiewicz states that they will be e-filing a victim statement report 
Dr. Brooke Lundbohm sworn in on direct by Atty. Szczupakiewicz. Cross examination by Atty. Cotton. Redirect by Atty. Szczupakiewicz.  Witness is excused and released from the subpoena.

Court breaks at 10:21 am. Court resumes at 10:30 am same appearances as above. 
Dr. Kenneth Robbins, appeared by video, sworn in on direct by Atty. Kuchler. Cross examination by Atty. Osborne. Redirect by Atty. Kuchler.  Witness is excused. 
Jessica Andrews sworn in on direct by Atty. Cotton. Ms. Geyser gives her consent to have Ms. Andrews speak in Court today. Court grants that Ms. Andrews can continue as a witness. Cross examination by Atty. Osborne. Redirect by Atty. Cotton.  Witness is excused and released from the subpoena.

Court breaks for the lunch hour and allows Ms. Geyser to return to the JV facility to meet with her Attorneys and family. 
Court resumes at 1:35 pm with the same appearances as above.
Dr. Kent Berney sworn in on direct by Atty. Kuchler. Cross examination by Atty. Szczupakiewicz. Redirect by Atty. Kuchler. Witness is excused. 

Court breaks at 2:49 pm. Court resumes at 3:04 pm with same appearances as above. 
Closing arguments by Atty. Szczupakiewicz. Closing arguments by Atty. Cotton

Court orders the defendant to be committed to the Department of Health Services for 40 YEARS commencing 2/1/18. Atty. Cotton will submit a calculation on days credit for the defendant.  Court further finds that conditional release would pose a significant risk of bodily injury to the defendant or others. Both the State and Defense stipulate to the institutional care.  Court orders placement as Institutional Care. Further findings made on the record as it relates to the administration of medication. Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms/body armor warnings provided to defendant. 

Court order Morgan Geyser to return to the Winnebago Mental Health Facility.

Defendant Morgan E Geyser in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton. Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. State moves to strike enhancer and is requesting the court to enter a NGI plea . Defense has no objection. Court strikes the enhancer cause.  Court relies on Dr. reports. No objections by either side.  Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds defendant guilty as to the criminal complaint and not guilty by NGI.
The Court orders the defendant committed to the Department of Health Services on today's date and orders the Department of Health Services to conduct a predisposition investigation and prepare a report to assist the court in framing a placement order under the commitment.  The report is to be furnished to the court no later than November 13, 2017. Upon receipt of the examiner's report, the Court will set a review hearing according to statute.  Court orders Morgan Geyser to remain at her facility for theses exams. State requests supplemental exams to be done by Dr. Lundbohm and Dr. Berney under section 971.17(2)(a). Court grants the request and signs the proper orders to that request.  Court orders that Ms. Geyser to have a 30 minute visit at the Waukesha Juvenile Center. 
Court removes the jury trial  and releases the summoned jurors. Sentenced date to be set once reports is returned.

Court is satisified it has the authority to issue the order for Mental Examination.  Court finds that the order would interfere with the defendant's Constitutional Rights.  Court grants the Motion to reconsider.  Court vacates the order ordering the exam.
